label: Description

label: Description
value: Two Indian girls dance to the music of a lute player, on a platform which is supported by half-figures of harpies.  Snakes hiss at plants in pots supported by puttos.  The original signature "Loire fecit" in the bottom center.

label: Physical description
value: Etching with engraving on white laid paper
Fan leaves, Third and fourth plates of the set, "Divers Desseins de grands Eventails, Encrans, et autres Ornamens, inventés et gravés par Nicolas Loire"

label: Description
value: Semicircular plates. An ovoidal medallion showing Arion riding over the sea and rises from an acanthus chalice. Paris of putti, of pedestals, of dolphins blowing water.
Fan leaves, Third and fourth plates of the set, "Divers Desseins de grands Eventails, Encrans, et autres Ornamens, inventés et gravés par Nicolas Loire"

label: Description
value: Ovoidal medallion showing Actaeon leaving Diana upon a pedestal. Laterally shown are putti in the backs of carriages to which pairs of doves are fastened.
Fan leaves, Fifth and sixth plates of the set, "Divers Desseins de grands Eventails, Encrans, et autres Ornamens, inventés et gravés par Nicolas Loire"

label: Description
value: Semicircular plate. Seated putti flank a flower basket. Snakes, snails, dragonflies.

label: Description
value: A fragment from a set of vestments found at the Cathedral of Lerida. A central band of eight-pointed stars enclosing rampant lions, separated by cross-shaped ornaments. Above, a band of pseudo-Kufic letters in white on gold ground. A narrow checked band below.  In blue, pink, and yellow silk and gold metallic threads.

value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns (beaten gold on vellum, wrapped around silk core) Technique: plain compound weave

label: Description
value: Textile printed in brown on white showing scenes from the story of Don Quixote.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Textile printed in red on white showing vignettes with allegorical scenes: a heralding angel of Fame on a flying pegasus before an unornamented triumphal arch and obelisk; a figure mourns next to the tomb of Voltaire in a field of obelisks; three graces dance in front of a seated Apollo; Jupiter's eagle holds a radiant bust of Voltaire in its beak; the figure of History writes Voltaire's name on the back of Time who carries an hourglass and scythe; an angel with a flaming torch greets a putti; a scholar converses with a hunchback man; a man cowers from a figure with snakes in their hands and hair, as well as from Cerberus, the three-headed dog of Hades; bats fly around a crop of flaming rock; Charon rows a boat decorated with the face of Medusa to the Elysian Fields, where the aged figure of Voltaire bows to be crowned with a laurel wreath by Henry IV while putti collect his written works; an elaborate fountain casts arcs of water in front of a building; a figure stand on the edge of a cliff in front of a classical building.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave; mordant for red

label: Description
value: Cotton fabric printed with four vignettes of groups of women in Norman costume with large headdresses. Floral sprays and the words Costumes Normands in the interstitial spaces.

label: Description
value: Scene of two shepherds and a boy among classical ruins. At right, a kneeling male figure wearing a turban crouches near a quiver of arrows. To his right, a standing figure with a shepherd's staff points his right hand towards an inscription on a curved wall. At right, a small boy in a cape holds a finger to his mouth. Behind him, a woman washes the face of a man (possibly a sculpture). Standing on the wall at upper right near a large carved urn is a cherub figure holding a bat.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Berlin 4007. Second state. The central part is -b. The drunken Silenus is brought to Bacchus who is seated on a rock. Ariadne on Naxos and a landscape are shown in the frame. Bottom: P. MARIETTE Auec Priuil. le Potre Fecit; an octagonal painting showing Bacchus being served wine is suggested in the frame of -a, instead of a polygonal landscape in -c.
